author: Pon Vasanth Arunachalam
text:
K.R. Ravi Rathinam, who had filed a case alleging that Rajinikanth-starrer ‘Lingaa’ was copied from his script, has now filed a petition demanding ‘Lingaa’ team to produce the original script of the movie in court.

The case, presently being tried in Additional District Munsif Court here, came up for hearing on Tuesday.

The petitioner, his counsel and counsel of the four defendants, including Mr. Rajinikanth and film producer ‘Rockline’ Venkatesh, appeared for the hearing.

During the hearing, the counsel of Mr. Ravi Rathinam filed a petition demanding that the original script of the movie be produced by the filmmakers so that it could be compared with his script.

Asking the defendants to respond to the petition, Judge N. Vishwanath postponed the hearing to Wednesday.

Mr. Ravi Rathinam had approached the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court prior to the release of the movie in December 2014. He had alleged that ‘Lingaa’ team had stolen the script he had prepared for a movie, named ‘Mullai Vanam 999’.
title: Lingaa case: petitioner asks for original script
